page.title: 03LOCAL TRAVEL IN HAUGHTON
page.content:
__________________________ a) Car ownership b) Ambulance c) Meals on Wheels d) Volunteer drivers e) Difficulties in transport
Very few households are without a car. It is almost a necessity in an area such as this. People without transport can use the ambulance service to attend clinics, which comes from either Chester or Crewe. Meals on wheels are cooked at Bickerton Institute and delivered by local ladies on a voluntary basis three times a week to the elderly and housebound people in the area. There are volunteer drivers who take old people to a day centre in Tarporley, and also to keep appointments in nearby towns or villages.
